results.title: Topology
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, John Halas and Harold Whitaker
results.brief_description:
An animated film which illustrates those properties of geometric figures or solid bodies which remain invariant under certain transformations.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Topless women talk about their lives
results.creator_credit: John Swimmer Productions, New Zealand Film Commission, Fiona Copland and Harry Sinclair
results.brief_description: This fresh, low-budget, comedy of manners explores contemporary relationships through the romantic entanglements and dilemmas facing a circle of friends in their late twenties. Sinclair’s debut feature is based on a ‘micro series’ of 4 minute episodes he made for New Zealand television that followed events in the lives of a group of friends living in Auckland, and is similarly structured as a series of loosely connected episodes. Liz (Danielle Cormack) is disturbed to find that she is pregnant and potentially facing motherhood as a single mother. Her horny and geekish boyfriend (Joel Tobeck), is refusing to deal with the impending return of his other girlfriend from overseas. Prue (Willa O’Neill), Liz’s best friend, is having traumas of her own as she deals with the joys of her forthcoming marriage to Niue-born Mike (Shimpal Lelisi). Then there is the neurotic linchpin of the film, aspiring film-maker and “psychologically scarred” Ant (Ian Hughes) who experiences the trauma of attending the painfully bad premier screening of the feature film he has written. Featuring a music soundtrack by well known New Zealand acts including The Chills, The Clean, The Bats and Chris Knox, “Topless Women” effortlessly mixes comedy and drama to portray Gen-X angst.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Swimmer Productions, New Zealand Film Commission, Fiona Copland and Harry Sinclair

results.title: Topaze
results.brief_description:
Topaze, a shy and idealistic provincial schoolteacher is used as a front by a disreputable financier to sign cheques and take the rap if necessary. But he catches on fast, and ends up by appropriating both his boss’s organization and his mistress. The combination of Jouvet’s magisterial performance and the pungent dialogue of the play that made Pagnol famous is irresistible. Pagnol himself would direct it, with Armoudy in 1936 and Fernandel in 1951 in the title role, and in 1961, Peter Sellers, directed himself disastrously in ‘Mr Topaz’. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Louis Gasnier ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Fred Langenfeld.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Paulet, Edwige Feuillere.

results.title: Top priority
results.brief_description: Set in an unspecified Third World country, this animated film, based on a short story by Enver Carim, suggests that “top priority” means different things to governments and to the governed. A drought-stricken family maintains a long and desperate vigil for a cloud of dust on the horizon signalling the arrival of irrigation pipes and pump. They are rewarded with a military convoy instead. Its top priority is a border war with a neighboring state, not pipes for the life-saving water the family must have.

results.title: Top of the world: taiga, tundra, ice-cap
results.brief_description: Shows the geographical characteristics and types of natural life to be found in the world’s three northern-most regions: Canada, Siberia and Alaska. Outlines the consequences of exploiting the areas resources.

results.title: Top Hat
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and Mark Sandrich
results.brief_description: One of the best musicals by the Fred Astaire-Ginger Rogers team. The featured songs are “Fancy Free”, sung and danced by Fred in his hotel suite as a way to bring him face to face with Ginger; “Isn’t this a lovely city?” which is sung and danced on a bandstand in a London park; “Top hat, white tie and tails” featuring Fred and the chorus in an exciting number; the unforgettable “Cheek to cheek”; and the lavishly staged finale, “The Piccolino”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and Mark Sandrich

results.title: Top guns and toxic whales
results.creator_credit: Central TV, Better World Society, Television Trust for the Environment, Lawrence Moore and Robbie Stamp
results.brief_description: Anthony Hopkins narrates this documentary which explores the issue of environmental security, and the link between ecological crises and military expenditure. The conflict bewteen massive military expenditure and the human problems of population growth, energy source depletion, and third world debt is explored.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Central TV, Better World Society, Television Trust for the Environment, Lawrence Moore and Robbie Stamp
